creditline: Gift of Gabriel P. and Yvonne M.L. Weisberg
description: cat. 26; young woman in profile with head turned to PL, seated in a side chair; woman wears long brown skirt, white apron and blouse, starched white bonnet, and orange and brown vest; window behind woman's head
medium: Watercolor with traces of graphite on card
provenance: [Marcel Lecomte, Paris, until possibly 1975; to Weisberg]; Yvonne and Gabriel Weisberg, Minneapolis (c. 1975–2003; given to Mia)
signed: Lower right in brown: Alex Lunois
text: Remembered primarily as a printmaker, Alexandre Lunois wandered widely in search of his subjects. His travels usually took him to warmer climes, but here he was apparently captivated by the traditional costume of a Scandinavian woman—the puffy cap, crisply ironed apron, and contrasting red vest.
title: Scandinavian Peasant Woman in an Interior
